lg.l: Acres on acres of low, hilly, poor land
Is the Manuka’s A species of myrtle, also known as tea tree. A low-growing tree that typically grows on poor soils. peculiar domain;
Acres on acres like heath on the moorland,
White with its blossom, like snow on the plain.
Acres on acres to battle a path through, Mānuka commonly grows in dense thickets.
Growing o’erhead like the tall pampas-grass,
Woe worth the day when the stranger shall pass!
Acres on acres, and acres on acres,
Fire hath swept clean through the length of the land;
But the Manuka will ne’er be demolished
Until old Neptune comes over the strand. Mānuka readily grows on land that has been cleared for pasture; the poem imagines that only inundation by the sea will prevent it from flourishing.
